abstract.text: Manage and persist your app’s model layer.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Core Data provides a set of classes that collaboratively support your app’s model layer:
describes your app’s types, including their properties and relationships.
tracks changes to instances of your app’s types.
saves and fetches instances of your app’s types from stores.
instance to set up the model, context, and store coordinator simultaneously.

abstract.text: Persist or cache data on a single device, or sync data to multiple devices with CloudKit.
An abstract superclass that you subclass to create a Core Data atomic store.
A concrete class that you use to represent basic nodes in a Core Data atomic store.
A description of a single attribute belonging to an entity.
A description of an attribute that derives its value by performing a calculation on a related attribute.
A description of a Core Data entity.
An abstract superclass defining the API through which Core Data communicates with a store.
A concrete class used to represent basic nodes in a Core Data incremental store.
The base class that all Core Data model objects inherit from.
An object space to manipulate and track changes to managed objects.
A compact, universal identifier for a managed object.
A programmatic representation of the
file describing your objects.
A container that encapsulates the Core Data stack in your app.
The abstract base class for all Core Data persistent stores.
A concrete class used to represent the results of an asynchronous request.
An object that enables an app’s contexts and the underlying persistent stores to work together.
A description object used to create and load a persistent store.
Criteria used to retrieve data from or save data to a persistent store.
The abstract base class for results returned from a persistent store coordinator.
A description of a single property belonging to an entity.
A description of a relationship between two entities.
An encapsulation of a collection of changes to be made by an object store in response to a save operation on a managed object context.
Define your app’s object structure with a data model file.
Create, store, and present records for a variety of data types.

abstract.text: Organize data in two different stores and implement a link between them.

doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/C.title: Linking Data Between Two Core Data Stores

abstract.text: Set up the classes that manage and persist your app’s objects.

doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/C.title: Setting up a Core Data stack

media-3118356.alt: Diagram showing that a persistent container instance contains references to a managed object model, a managed object context, and a persistent store coordinator that connects to your app’s stores.
